source_sentence: 爾時，藥上菩提薩埵摩訶薩埵白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the Bhaiṣajyasamuccaya Bodhisattva Mahāsattva said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 何因緣故如來出世？」
translation: What are the causes for the Tathāgata's appearance in the world?

source_sentence: 佛告藥上菩提薩埵言：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha told Yaosheng Bodhisattva, Good sons!

source_sentence: 為令眾生多聞具足，是故如來出現於世。
translation: In order to cause sentient beings to be well-versed, the Tathāgata therefore appears in the world.

source_sentence: 如來出世開甘露法，若如來出世則知一切法。
translation: The Tathāgata appears in the world to reveal the ambrosia of the Dharma, and if the Tathāgata appears in the world, then he knows all dharmas.

source_sentence: 以方便故，知世間法、出世間法，知世間智、出世間智。」
translation: Because of skillful means, he knows worldly and transmundane dharmas and knows worldly cognition and transmundane cognition.

source_sentence: 藥上菩提薩埵白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Yaosheng Bodhisattva said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 世尊知何等法？」
translation: Bhagavān, what teaching does he know?

source_sentence: 佛告藥上菩提薩埵言：「藥上！
translation: The Buddha told Yaosheng Bodhisattva, Yaosheng!

source_sentence: 如來知正法智。
translation: The Tathāgata knows the cognition of the right teaching.

source_sentence: 藥上！
translation: Bhaiṣajyasamu!

source_sentence: 以是智故總攝一切法。
translation: Because of this knowledge, it's the general collection of all dharmas.

source_sentence: 藥上！
translation: Bhaiṣajyasamu!

source_sentence: 若眾生聞如來出世信法者，此是第一利益。
translation: If sentient beings hear the Tathāgata's transmundane faith in the teaching, this is the first benefit.

source_sentence: 藥上！
translation: Bhaiṣajyasamu!

source_sentence: 譬如有人出行治生，為得利故將千人眾擔負金寶。
translation: Suppose there's a person who travels on a journey to govern sentient beings and carries a thousand people carrying a load of gold treasure for profit.

source_sentence: 彼人父母告其人言：『子善諦聽！
translation: The people's parents told them, 'Listen well and quietly!'

source_sentence: 此金寶者是他之物，汝好守護莫使亡失。』
translation: This gold treasure is another thing, so guard it well and don't let it go.'

source_sentence: 其人持寶未經多時自縱放逸，所持金寶悉皆散失。
translation: Before a long time had passed, that man held the treasure and indulged in self-indulgence, and all the gold and treasure he held scattered away.

source_sentence: 是時彼人憂箭射心，羞愧慚恥不能歸家。
translation: At the time, that person's mind was sad and angry, and they were shameful and embarrassed and couldn't return home.

source_sentence: 時彼父母聞已憂愁悲泣而說此言：『我等生此惡子，但有子名生我家內，
translation: Having heard these words, the parents wept in sorrow and said, “We gave birth to this wicked child.

source_sentence: 財物悉皆散失，令我等貧苦，為他奴僕絕望而死。』
translation: All our possessions will be scattered, leaving us poor and suffering, and we'll die as slaves and servants of others with no hope.'

source_sentence: 子聞父母既喪亡已亦絕望死。
translation: When the son heard that his parents had died, he also gave up hope of dying.

source_sentence: 如是，如是！
translation: So it is, so it is!

source_sentence: 藥上！
translation: Bhaiṣajyasamu!

source_sentence: 佛說此法，於我法中無淨信者，彼無所望，臨命終時，為憂惱箭射心而死。
translation: When the Buddha teaches this teaching, there's no pure faith in my teaching; they have no hope, and when their life ends, they die with an arrow of grief and anguish that shoots into their hearts.

source_sentence: 如彼父母，為彼金寶絕望憂惱。
translation: They're like their parents, who are cut off from hope and grief for their gold treasure.

source_sentence: 「如是，藥上！
translation: So it is, Bhaiṣajyasamudgata!

source_sentence: 於我法中無淨心者，臨命終時受諸苦痛。
translation: Someone who lacks a pure mind in regard to self and dharmas will experience pain and suffering at the end of their life.

source_sentence: 先福受盡彼不種善，臨死時至憂惱箭射，墮於地獄、畜生、餓鬼受諸苦痛，
translation: When their former blessings are exhausted and they don't plant goodness, they'll fall into hell, an animal, or a hungry ghost at the time of death with grief and anguish when they're about to die and suffer pain.

source_sentence: 作如是言：『誰救濟我，令我得離地獄、畜生、餓鬼之苦？』
translation: They say, 'Who will rescue me so that I can escape the suffering of hell, animals, and hungry ghosts?'

source_sentence: 又如父母告其子言：『未來病苦，病有死苦，汝等得解脫時見行識生，
translation: “Furthermore, it is just as when a father and mother tell their child, ‘There will be painful illness in the future. There will be painful death from illness.

source_sentence: 身受苦痛遍體燋惱。
translation: Their bodies are pained and distressed, and their whole bodies are tormented.

source_sentence: 自觀已死眼不見色，耳不聞聲，四支皆痛必歸於死，遍體頑癡猶如木石無所覺知。』
translation: He observes for himself that after death, his eyes don't see form, his ears don't hear sound, the four limbs of pain will surely return to death, and his whole body is as stubborn and deluded as wood and stone without

source_sentence: 子答父母語言：『莫作是語，令我怖畏。
translation: The son answered his parents, saying, 'Don't say that, which will cause me to fear it.

source_sentence: 觀身無熱，亦無餘病，唯見死怖。
translation: He observes that his body has no fever and no other illnesses, but sees only the fear of death.

source_sentence: 我當歸誰？
translation: To whom will I return?

source_sentence: 誰救濟我？
translation: Who will rescue me?

source_sentence: 父母若天，誰能救拔？』
translation: If their parents are gods, who can rescue them?'

source_sentence: 父母答言：『祭祀天神必得安隱。』
translation: His parents replied, 'The gods and goddesses will surely attain peace.'

source_sentence: 子答父母：『當速祭祀以求安樂，速至天祠問守廟人。』
translation: The son answered his parents, 'Should you quickly perform an offering to seek peace and happiness and quickly go to the god's shrine to ask the guardian of the shrine?'

source_sentence: 時彼父母到天祠中，燒香求願。
translation: Their parents then went to the deva temple, burned incense, and begged for their vow.

source_sentence: 守廟者言：『天神瞋怒，須殺羊、殺人以用祭祀，汝子可脫。』
translation: The guardian of the shrine said, 'The gods are angry and need to kill sheep and kill people for an offering, so your son can be freed.'

source_sentence: 爾時，父母自思惟言：『我等云何？
translation: At that point, their parents thought to themselves, 'What about us?'

source_sentence: 我既貧窮，若天神瞋我子必死，若天神喜必得大恩。』
translation: Since I'm poor, if the gods are angry with me, my child will surely die, and if the gods are joyful, they'll surely attain great benefit.'

source_sentence: 時速歸家盡賣家財得羊一口。
translation: At the time, he quickly returned home and sold all his family's property to obtain a mouthful of sheep.

source_sentence: 復語餘人：『且貸我金，十日相還。
translation: Again, he said to the others, 'Let me borrow my gold and return it ten days.

source_sentence: 若無相還，我身當為君作奴僕。』
translation: If you return without marks, I'll be your slave and servant.'

source_sentence: 其人得金詣市買人，所買之人不知當殺以祭天祠。
translation: That man obtained the gold and went to the marketplace to buy it, but the buyer didn't know he was going to kill him to offer it to a deva temple.

source_sentence: 病人父母愚癡無智竟不至家，直詣天祠語守廟者：『汝速為我設祭天祠。』
translation: The sick man's parents were foolish and ignorant, so they didn't go home but went straight to the deva temple and said to the guardian shrine guard, 'Quickly set up a heavenly shrine for me.'

source_sentence: 爾時，父母自殺羊、殺人然火祭天。
translation: At the time, his parents killed a sheep and murdered one of them to be sacrificed to the fire deity.

source_sentence: 然後天下告彼父母：『汝等莫怖，我護汝子令得安隱。』
translation: The whole world then told their parents, 'Don't be afraid; I will protect your child and make him at ease.'

source_sentence: 爾時，父母踊躍歡喜作如是言：『天神與我大恩，令我子差。』
translation: At that point, the parents jumped and rejoiced, saying, 'The gods and goddesses gave me great kindness to send my child away.'

source_sentence: 時彼父母歡喜還家，見兒已死。
translation: The parents then rejoiced and returned home, seeing that their child had died.

source_sentence: 爾時，父母見子死已生大愁惱，憂箭射心絕望而死。」
translation: At the time, his parents saw their son die and became greatly distressed, grieved, and died with an arrow of sorrow in their hearts.

source_sentence: 佛告藥上：「善男子！

translation: So it is with those who approach bad friends.

source_sentence: 爾時，藥上菩提薩埵白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the Bhaiṣajyasamuccaya Bodhisattva said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 如是眾生墮於何處？」
translation: Where will such sentient beings fall?

source_sentence: 佛告藥上菩提薩埵：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha told Yaosheng Bodhisattva, Good man!

translation: Don't ask about this matter.

source_sentence: 藥上菩提薩埵白佛言：「世尊！

source_sentence: 願佛慈悲說如是人墮在何處？」
translation: May the Buddha compassionately explain where such a person will fall?

source_sentence: 佛告藥上菩提薩埵言：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha told Yaosheng Bodhisattva, Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝今諦聽！
translation: Listen attentively now!

source_sentence: 其人母者墮於大叫地獄之中；
translation: Their mothers will fall into the hell of great wailing.

source_sentence: 其父墮於眾合地獄；
translation: Their fathers will fall into the hell of many combinations.

source_sentence: 其子墮於火燒然地獄；
translation: Their children will fall into the burning hell of fire.

source_sentence: 守天廟者墮於阿鼻大地獄中。」
translation: Those who guard the heavenly shrine will fall into the great hell of Avīci Hell.

source_sentence: 爾時藥上菩提薩埵摩訶薩埵白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the Bhaiṣajyasamuccaya Bodhisattva Mahāsattva said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 彼枉死人生於何處？」
translation: Where will they die in vain?

source_sentence: 佛告藥上菩提薩埵言：「彼枉死人生於三十三天之上。」
translation: The Buddha told Yaosheng Bodhisattva, They'll die in vain and be born above the Trāyastriṃśa gods.

source_sentence: 藥上菩提薩埵白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Yaosheng Bodhisattva said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 彼枉死人何因緣故，生於三十三天之上？」
translation: What are the causes and conditions for that person who dies in vain to be born above the Trāyastriṃśa gods?

source_sentence: 佛告藥上菩提薩埵言：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha told Yaosheng Bodhisattva, Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝今諦聽！
translation: Listen attentively now!

source_sentence: 彼人臨死時，起一念淨心歸依佛陀。
translation: When that person is about to die, they give rise to a single thought of pure mind and rely on the Buddha.

source_sentence: 以此善根，當六十劫受於三十三天之樂，八十劫中自識宿命。
translation: Because of these roots of goodness, he'll experience the happiness of the Trāyastriṃśa gods for 60 eons and know his past lives for 80 eons.

source_sentence: 所生之處離諸憂惱，生生之處離諸憂惱，一切苦滅。
translation: The place where they are born is free of grief, the place where they are born is free of grief, and all suffering ceases.

source_sentence: 藥上！
translation: Bhaiṣajyasamu!

source_sentence: 近惡知識，不得入於涅槃。」
translation: If you approach bad friends, you won't be allowed to enter nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 藥上菩提薩埵白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Yaosheng Bodhisattva said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 云何眾生不能入於涅槃？」
translation: How can sentient beings not enter nirvāṇa?

source_sentence: 佛告藥上菩提薩埵言：「欲求涅槃者當勤精進。」
translation: The Buddha told Yaosheng Bodhisattva, Those who want to pursue nirvāṇa should diligently exert effort.

source_sentence: 藥上菩提薩埵白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Yaosheng Bodhisattva said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 云何名精進？」
translation: What's called effort?

source_sentence: 佛告藥上菩提薩埵：「善男子！

source_sentence: 精進者名須驢多波帝，逆流之果名精進處，娑吉利陀伽彌果名精進處，
translation: The fruit of energy is called ‘sūda-padi’; the fruit of going against the flow is called ‘sphere of energy;’ the fruit of Sāgiri-dagama’ is called ‘sphere of energy.

source_sentence: 阿那伽彌果名精進處，阿羅訶果名精進處，波羅提迦佛陀果名精進處，
translation: The fruit of andagamī is called the sphere of zeal. The fruit of arhatship is called the sphere of zeal. The fruit of pratikabuddha is called the sphere of zeal.

source_sentence: 緣覺之智名精進處，菩提薩埵名字、菩提薩埵地果，名精進處。
translation: The cognition of pratyekabuddhas is called the locus of effort, and the names of bodhisattvas and the fruits of bodhisattvahood are called the locus of effort.

source_sentence: 藥上！
translation: Bhaiṣajyasamu!

source_sentence: 如是等處名精進處。」
translation: Such places are called the place of effort.

source_sentence: 藥上菩提薩埵白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Yaosheng Bodhisattva said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 世尊云何逆流？
translation: Bhagavān, how did you go against the flow?

source_sentence: 云何逆流果？」
translation: What's the fruit of going against the flow?

source_sentence: 佛告藥上菩提薩埵：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha told Yaosheng Bodhisattva, Good man!

source_sentence: 譬如有人種於樹木，彼種樹已即日生芽，彼樹一日上下各生長一由旬。
translation: It's like when someone plants a tree, and after planting that tree, the sun produces its sprouts; that tree grows one yojana high and one yojana low on a day.

source_sentence: 復有一人，亦復種樹不得其所，風動不生移置異處。
translation: Again, there was a man who also planted trees but couldn't find them, and when the wind moved, they didn't grow and moved to another place.

source_sentence: 二人共諍互相誹謗，彼人如是共相諍論。
translation: When two people fight and denigrate each other, that person thus argues with each other.

source_sentence: 國王聞之即勅臣言：『某處二人互相誹謗，速往喚來。』
translation: When the king heard this, he commanded his ministers, saying, 'Somewhere, these two people denigrate each other, so quickly go and summon them.'

source_sentence: 「傍臣受教遣使往捉。
translation: The attendant ministers were instructed to send an envoy to capture him.

source_sentence: 時彼使人微服而去，至彼人所作如是言：『王喚汝等。』
translation: The messenger then departed, subtly dressed, and went to the place where he was staying, saying, 'The king summoned you.'

source_sentence: 時彼二人驚怖憂愁：『王今何故命我二人？』
translation: They were then frightened and distressed, 'Why did the king order us two of them now?'

source_sentence: 是時二人既至王所默然而立。
translation: When the two men arrived at the king's place, they remained silent and stood up.

source_sentence: 時王問言：『汝等何故共相誹謗而起鬪諍？』
translation: The king then asked, 'Why are you all denigrating each other and creating a fight?'

source_sentence: 「時彼二人白大王言：『大王！
translation: Those two people then said to the great king, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 聽我所說。
translation: Listen to what I teach.

source_sentence: 我借得少許空閑之處，種植樹林，即日生芽及葉，華果熟者中半。
translation: I borrowed a little bit of an uncultivated land and planted it in a forest. As soon as the sun came out, buds and leaves grew on each other’s bodies, with flowers and fruits growing one-half full blo

source_sentence: 此人種植不生芽葉及以華果，須臾數移彼種不生，來見謗毀而起鬪諍。
translation: This person plants sprouts, leaves, flowers, and fruits that don't grow and moves them moment after moment without producing those seeds, and they come to see and criticize them and give rise to arguments.

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 如是之事，大王應知我無罪過。』
translation: For such a thing, the great king should know that I'm not guilty.'

source_sentence: 「爾時大王，集諸大臣滿三十億，告諸臣言：『汝等各說。』
translation: At the time, the great king gathered 3,000 billion ministers and told their ministers, 'You each explain it.'

source_sentence: 諸臣白言：『我等不知說何等語？』
translation: The ministers said, 'We don't know what to say.'

source_sentence: 「王問諸臣：『汝等頗見即日種樹即生芽葉及以華果熟者中半。』
translation: The king asked the ministers, 'Do you see how many of those who sow trees on that day immediately give rise to sprouts, leaves, and flowers and fruits that are half-ripe?'

source_sentence: 「爾時諸臣從座而起。
translation: It was then that the ministers rose from their seats.

source_sentence: 白大王言：『大王！
translation: He said to the great king, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 我等不能決定信受如此之言。
translation: We can't definitely believe such words.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 大王！
translation: Great king!

source_sentence: 此事希有。』
translation: This is a rare thing.'

source_sentence: 爾時大王問彼人言：『如汝所說，是事實不？』
translation: It was then that the great king asked those people, 'As you say, is this true?'

source_sentence: 爾時彼人白大王言：『此實不謬。』
translation: It was then that the man said to the great king, 'This is really not wrong.'

source_sentence: 王復答言：『如汝所說如此之事，即日種樹即生芽葉及以華果，此事難信。』
translation: The king then answered, 'As you've said, it's difficult to believe such things that the sun plants trees, which give rise to sprouts, leaves, and flowers and fruits.'

source_sentence: 爾時彼人白大王言：『願王自植知其虛實。』
translation: It was then that the man said to the great king, 'May the king plant it for himself and know its true nature.'

source_sentence: 「時王集三十億臣禁守彼人，然後大王自種其樹，不生芽葉，不生華果。
translation: The king then gathered 3,000 billion ministers to guard that person, and the great king planted his own trees so that they didn't give rise to buds or leaves or flowers or fruits.

source_sentence: 爾時大王，心大恚怒勅諸臣言：『汝等速取利斧，彼所種樹仰令斫伐。』
translation: It was then that the great king became angry and commanded his ministers, saying, 'Quickly take a sharp axe and slay the tree they planted.'

source_sentence: 爾時諸臣受王教令斫斷彼樹，一樹斷已生十二樹，斫十二樹斷生二十四樹，
translation: It was then that the ministers were instructed by the king to cut down one tree, twelve trees arose after cutting it down, and twenty-four trees arose after cutting down twelve trees.

source_sentence: 莖、葉、華、果皆是七寶。
translation: Stems, leaves, flowers, and fruits are all seven treasures.

source_sentence: 爾時二十四樹，變生二十四億雞鳥，皆是金嘴七寶羽翼。
translation: At the time, twenty-four trees and twenty-four billion chickens were born, all with golden beaked seven-jeweled feathers.

source_sentence: 爾時，大王復生瞋怒，自執利斧往伐彼樹。
translation: At the time, the great king became angry again and took his sharp axe and went to cut down that tree.

source_sentence: 王斫樹時，從樹出生甘泉美水。
translation: When the king was eating a tree, sweet springs and good water came forth from that tree.

source_sentence: 時王慚愧勅諸臣言：『放彼二人。』
translation: The king then shamefully commanded his ministers,'released those two people.'

source_sentence: 諸臣白言：『大王！
translation: The ministers said, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 受教。』
translation: I'll accept the teaching.'

source_sentence: 諸臣去已，放彼二人將至王所。
translation: After the ministers had departed, they released those two men and led them to the king.

source_sentence: 王問其人：『汝種此樹。
translation: The king asked the man, 'You planted this tree.

source_sentence: 斫汝一樹生十二樹，斫十二樹生二十四樹。
translation: If you cut down one tree, twelve trees will grow, and if you cut down twelve trees, twenty-four will grow.

source_sentence: 我所種樹不生芽葉，不生華果。
translation: The trees I plant don't give rise to sprouts and leaves, and flowers and fruits don't grow.

source_sentence: 此事云何？』
translation: What's the matter?'

source_sentence: 其人答王：『如我此福德，大王則無如是福德。』
translation: That person answered the king, 'Suppose I had this merit, and the great king didn't have such merit.'

source_sentence: 爾時三十億大臣胡跪，白其人言：『汝可治國而居王位。』
translation: It was then that 3,000 billion ministers knelt down and said to those people, 'You may govern the kingdom and live in his position.'

source_sentence: 「『我不求王位，　　不求世財寶；
translation: 'I don't seek kingship, and I don't seek worldly possessions.

source_sentence: 若有所犯，不加害汝，亦不殺汝，皆當安隱莫生怖畏。』
translation: If someone commits any offense, they won't harm you or kill you, and they'll all be comfortable and don't become frightened.'

source_sentence: 藥上！
translation: Bhaiṣajyasamu!

source_sentence: 如來亦復如是，燒諸煩惱、滅諸病苦，猶如彼人為令闇室眾生安隱，自燒而死。
translation: The Tathagata is also like this. He burns away the defilements and extinguishes the pain of illness, just as a man in order to make living beings in a dark room feel at ease burns himself and dies.

source_sentence: 如來如是，為諸眾生令得安隱，不惜身命拔諸繫縛令得解脫。
translation: Thus does the Tathāgata thus cause sentient beings to attain peace, and he doesn't spare his life to remove the fetters so they can attain liberation.

source_sentence: 如是，藥上！
translation: So it is, Bhaiṣajyarāja!

source_sentence: 如來永離三毒之惱，為諸世間作大燈明，於地獄、畜生、餓鬼、阿修羅，
translation: The Tathāgata is forever free of the afflictions of the three poisons, and he becomes a great lamp for all worlds. In hell, among animals, among hungry ghosts, and among the asuras, he illuminates sentient beings with

source_sentence: 老少眾生拔令解脫。」
translation: Old and young sentient beings are pulled out and liberated.

source_sentence: 「最勝好福田，　　一切田中勝，
translation: “The most excellent field of merit is the best of all fields.

source_sentence: 世間無上尊。　　增長諸佛子，
translation: Unsurpassed honored in the world, they will grow as offspring of buddhas.

source_sentence: 佛田最勝田，　　能除諸怖畏。
translation: The Buddha field is the supreme field, Able to remove all fears.

source_sentence: 大師善方便，　　守護諸眾生，
translation: The great teacher skillfully protects sentient beings Through skillful means.

source_sentence: 住於涅槃界，　　而示在世間，
translation: Abiding in the realm of nirvana, They show it in the world.

source_sentence: 令世間寂滅。　　佛為無上師，
translation: The Buddha is the supreme teacher, causing all sentient beings to enter nirvana.

source_sentence: 救護少眾生，　　亦救老眾生，
translation: They rescue sentient beings who are small, And they also rescue those who are old.

source_sentence: 三界諸眾生，　　方便而度之。
translation: The sentient beings of the three realms are liberated by skillful means.

source_sentence: 閉諸地獄門，　　及畜生、餓鬼；
translation: They shut the gates of all hells, As well as the realms of animals and hungry ghosts.

source_sentence: 此世得安樂，　　他世亦安樂。」
translation: This world will attain well-being, and so will the other worlds.

source_sentence: 「善哉！見善人，　　善哉！見佛陀，
translation: “Good! Good, you see a good person— Good, you see the Buddha.

source_sentence: 善哉！聞法者，　　善哉！能敬僧，
translation: Good, good! Whoever hears the Dharma Is able to venerate the Sangha.

source_sentence: 善哉！此法門，　　滅除一切惡。」
translation: Excellent! This is the teaching that extinguishes all evil.”

source_sentence: 爾時諸天，於虛空中，而說偈言：爾時如來，即時微笑而說偈言：爾時，
translation: At that moment the gods spoke these verses in the sky:

source_sentence: 藥上菩提薩埵摩訶薩埵白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Yaosheng bodhisattva Samantabhadra Mahāsattva said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 何因緣故如來微笑？
translation: What are the reasons why the Tathāgata smiles?

source_sentence: 若無因緣，如來終不現希有相。」
translation: If there were no causes and conditions, the Tathāgata would never show rare appearances.

translation: The Buddha told Yaosheng, Good man!

source_sentence: 汝見此等少眾生不？」
translation: Do you see these few sentient beings?

source_sentence: 藥上白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Yaosheng said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 唯然已見。」
translation: Yes, I've seen it.

source_sentence: 佛告藥上：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha told Yaosheng, Good man!

source_sentence: 此諸眾生今日皆得住於十地。」
translation: Today, these sentient beings will all be able to live in the tenth ground.

source_sentence: 爾時，藥上菩提薩埵摩訶薩埵，踊身虛空高八萬由旬，共八萬億天子，
translation: At that time the yaksusheng pusi sattva mahāsattva rose up into the sky, rising eighty thousand yojanas in height to a height of eighty myriad koṭis of celestial beings.

source_sentence: 於如來上散眾妙花，地上年少諸眾生等皆禮佛足。
translation: On top of the Tathāgata, he spreads a multitude of marvelous flowers, and the young sentient beings on the ground bowed at his feet.

source_sentence: 爾時，藥上於虛空中而作是言：「三千大千世界眾生皆聞此聲，地獄眾生聞此聲者悉得解脫，
translation: It was then that the Buddha Bhaiṣajyarāja said to the gods in the sky, “Three thousand great one-thousand worlds hear this sound. All the sentient beings in hell who hear it will be liberated.

source_sentence: 三十三天聞此音聲皆來集會。」
translation: The Trāyastriṃśa gods hear this sound and all come to the assembly.

source_sentence: 時三千大千世界六種震動，時大海中八萬四千龍王動而來集，三萬億閻浮提夜叉俱來集會，
translation: The great manifold cosmos thundered in six ways. At that time eighty-four thousand great dragon kings emerged from the great ocean and assembled there. Three hundred myriads of koṭis of Jambudvīpa yakṣas came to

source_sentence: 二萬五千億羅剎餓鬼俱來集會，時如來所大眾悉集。
translation: Twenty-five thousand million Rāṣṭrapāla hungry ghosts all came to the assembly, and the Tathāgata's great congregation was then assembled.

source_sentence: 爾時，如來為諸年少眾生說法。
translation: At the time, the Tathāgata was teaching the Dharma for young sentient beings.

source_sentence: 從十方世界有百千億諸菩薩眾，各以自神力俱來集會。
translation: Hundreds of thousands of myriads of koṭis of bodhisattvas from the worlds in the ten directions assembled, each with their own supernormal powers.

source_sentence: 爾時，藥上菩提薩埵白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the Bhaiṣajyasamuccaya Bodhisattva said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 從十方國有無量菩薩俱來集會，無量天、龍、夜叉、揵闥婆、阿修羅、迦樓羅、餓鬼、地獄，
translation: Innumerable gods, dragons, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, hungry ghosts, and hell-dwellers came from the ten directions to this assembly.

source_sentence: 皆來集會欲聞正法，唯願世尊當為說之。」
translation: They all come to the assembly want to hear the right teaching, so may the Bhagavān explain it for them.

source_sentence: 佛告藥上菩提薩埵摩訶薩埵言：「善男子！
translation: The Buddha addressed the Bhaiṣajyasamuccaya Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝下至此。」
translation: Come down here.

source_sentence: 爾時藥上菩提薩埵，以自神力從上而下，向佛合掌頂禮佛足，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: It was then that the bodhisattva Bhaiṣajyasamudgata Bodhisattva, using his own supernormal powers, descended from the top of his head and bowed at the Buddha's feet with joined palms and said to him, Bhaga

translation: What are the causes and conditions that make a dharma-lump called a dharma-lump?

translation: The Buddha told Yaosheng, Good man!

source_sentence: 法聚者名曰淨行，淨行者能離一切不善之法。
translation: A cluster of dharmas is called pure practice, and a pure practitioner can part with all unwholesome dharmas.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝見如此少眾生不？」
translation: Do you see such few sentient beings?

source_sentence: 藥上白佛：「唯然已見。」
translation: Yaosheng said to the Buddha, Yes, I've seen it.

source_sentence: 佛告藥上：「此諸眾生離邪婬故，必得諸陀羅尼，必得具足一切諸法。」
translation: The Buddha told Yaosheng, Because these sentient beings are free of sexual misconduct, they'll surely attain the dhāraṇī and will surely be fully endowed with all dharmas.
